sentences.en: Bureaucracy can entangle ventures for months.
sentences.cn: 官僚体制会使风险投资搁置好几个月。

sentences.en: Bureaucracy is ever desirous of spreading its influence and its power.
sentences.cn: 官僚主义无时无刻不想扩大它的影响和权力.

sentences.en: Bureaucracy may be said as a disease in our very vitals.
sentences.cn: 官僚主义可说是我们的心腹之患.

sentences.en: Females become increasingly rare at the higher levels of the Soviet bureaucracy.
sentences.cn: 在苏联较高的官僚阶层中,妇女就越来越少了.

sentences.en: He also conveyed his views and the views of the bureaucracy.
sentences.cn: 他也表达了自己的看法和官方的看法。

sentences.en: In the meantime he left me to manage the bureaucracy.
sentences.cn: 在此期间,他把我留下来对付官僚机构.

sentences.en: It is hard to understand all the minute gradation of their bureaucracy.
sentences.cn: 很难弄清楚他们那套官僚体制全部细微的等级分别.

sentences.en: People usually complain about having to deal with too much bureaucracy.
sentences.cn: 人们经常抱怨不得不应付太多的繁文缛节。
官僚主义已变得僵化了.

sentences.en: The frustration we felt with the bureaucracy was based on solid reasons.
sentences.cn: 我们对官僚机构所感到的失望是有其确凿原因的.

sentences.en: The masses won't go for bureaucracy.
sentences.cn: 对于官僚主义,群众是不买账的.
消除不必要的官僚体制

sentences.en: Their overbearing bureaucracy and their self - satisfied airs are really more than one can stand.
sentences.cn: 他们那种神气十足的官僚架子实在叫人吃不消.

sentences.en: They are faced with a mountain of bureaucracy.
sentences.cn: 他们面对一大堆繁文缛节。

sentences.en: They're making efforts to streamline their normally cumbersome bureaucracy.
sentences.cn: 他们正努力精简本来繁冗复杂的官僚体制。

trans.tran_cn: 官僚制度，官僚作风，官僚主义
trans.tran_en: a complicated official system that is annoying or confusing because it has a lot of rules, processes etc
